IndustryType: Fuel storage (including heating, retail sale, etc.)

Title: Explosion and fast paced fire causing the death of one person

Reasons.ItemDescription: Substances involved: greater than 5% of quantity in Column 3 of Annex I
Injury to persons: >= 1 fatalities, >= 6 hospitalizing injuries etc.
Immediate damage to the environment (according to Annex VI)

ADFireMajors.ItemDescription: pool fire (burning pool of liquid, contained or uncontained)
jet flame (burning jet of fluid from orifice)
flash fire (burning vapour cloud, subsonic flame front)
fireball (burning mass rising in air, often after BLEVE)

ADFireInitiating.ItemDescription: pool fire (burning pool of liquid, contained or uncontained)
jet flame (burning jet of fluid from orifice)
flash fire (burning vapour cloud, subsonic flame front)
fireball (burning mass rising in air, often after BLEVE)

ADExplosionMajors.ItemDescription: rapid phase-transition explosion (rapid change of state)
VCE (vapour cloud explosion; supersonic wave front)

ADExplosionInitiating.ItemDescription: rapid phase-transition explosion (rapid change of state)
VCE (vapour cloud explosion; supersonic wave front)

Installation_Description: <span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial" lang="EN-US"></span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial" lang="EN-US">petrol tank No. 5002 (5000 m<sup>3</sup>)</span>
Other: Cleaning of the bottom area of an almost empty 5000 m3 “ESZ-95” petrol tank with entering the tank itself. This activity was performed to prepare the tank for the tank authentication process.

Causes_Description:
<span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial" lang="EN-US">The
employees of the subcontractors who performed the cleaning process in the
explosive zones of category “0” and “1” (interior area of the tank, containment
area) supposedly used malfunctioning electric appliances or ones with not
appropriate protection and/or did not work in accordance with the standards.
Electrostatic charging could also be a possible cause. The explosion was
supposedly caused by an electric spark in the interior area of the tank and the
hydrocarbon-air mixture exploded.</span>

CausesHumans.ItemDescription: operator health (includes ailments, intoxication, death, etc.)
wilful disobedience/failure to carry out duties

CausesExternals.ItemDescription: utilities failure (electricity, gas, water, steam air, etc.)
